text: Daundre Barnaby (December 9, 1990 â€“ March 27, 2015) was a Canadian track runner in the 400m. He competed for the Mississippi State Bulldogs and ran for Canada at the 2012 Summer Olympics in London, finishing 6th in his heat in the 400m. Barnaby disappeared on March 27, 2015 while swimming in the ocean at a training camp in Saint Kitts, and was declared dead later that same day. ==References== Category:1990 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Black Canadian sportspeople Category:Canadian athletes Category:Olympians for Canada Category:Deaths by drowning
title: Daundre Barnaby
